subject: Re: [junit] Git problems
msgSnippet: ... That would be nice! But I seem to have successfully imported all of CVS locally. Sourceforge access was faster than I gave it credit for. First off, I
messageBody:
2009/1/16 kentb <kentb@...>:
> I haven't seen it. It looks very powerful but I'm looking for simple and
> fool proof. I'd like a web page somewhere with one input field for the CVS
> repository and one input field for the Github project and a button labelled
> "Poof!".
>
> Cheers,
>
> Kent Beck
> Three Rivers Institute
>

That would be nice! But I seem to have successfully imported all of
CVS locally. Sourceforge access was faster than I gave it credit for.

First off, I checked out /cvsroot/junit junit locally.
# go into the working copy
$ cd junit
# clone the CVS repos into local git repos
$ git cvsimport -v -C ../junit.git
# Check that the result looks fine
$ cd ../junit.git
$ git branch
Version4
Version431
* master
origin
saff_r41_runner_refactoring
vendor
$ git log | head
commit 34dd9f4e2bebbcf694dcb855a29edff9243a10d3
Author: kbeck <kbeck>
Date: Tue Jan 6 04:02:00 2009 +0000

Fixed 2191102 and 2196462.

commit 90bf3119a6326671cc467386036302cc6040f752
Author: kbeck <kbeck>
Date: Sat Dec 20 15:36:48 2008 +0000

I'm running Ubuntu 8.10 with default packages for git-* and cvsps.

I then created a new empty repository on github via the GUI and pushed
it all up from my local repository.

$ git remote add origin git@...:jabley/junit.git
$ git push -v origin --all

http://github.com/jabley/junit/tree/master

I think that's what you're after?

If you like, I'll take a look at transferring ownership of that
repository on github?

Cheers,

James
